Description:
Ballistics of the 3UBM10 110x910mmR round with the 3BM24 "Kalach" APFSDS, fired from the T-12 and MT-12 anti-tank guns. Shares design with "Izomer", "Kalach", "Zastup" and "Zakolka" for 100mm, 115mm and 125mm guns. Development persuant to directive issued in 1972, these rounds entered service in 1977-1979, although mass production began in 1975-1976. 

Loads 6.55 kg of 15/1 DG-4 grains, with 0.25 kg of ignition charge and flame suppressant. Projectile travel estimated from a gun length of 6300 mm (63 calibers), chamber length 915 mm.

Pressure in copper crusher gauge:
Temp  M.V. P.cp
°C    m/s  MPa
-40  1430  240
+15  1548  335
+40  1600  392

References:
- 100-мм ПРОТИВОТАНКОВАЯ ПУШКА MT-12 РУКОВОДСТВО СЛУЖБЫ (1980)
- артиллерийские метательные заряды (Г.Г. Валеев, В.Ф. Сопин, Б.А. Соков, 2004)
